newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul says three N.Koreans killed not captured.
newsitem.headline: Seoul says three N.Koreans killed not captured.

text.p: A South Korean defence ministry spokesman said the three North Koreans earlier reported as having been captured alive on Thursday had in fact been killed.
This brings to six the number of infiltrators shot dead on Thursday by South Korean security forces.
On Wednesday, 11 infiltrators dropped in South Korea from a submarine were found dead in an apparent mass suicide on top of a mountain. One other was captured alive.
Authorities believe around 20 North Koreans were on board the submarine that grounded on rocks near the east coast city of Kangnung in the early hours of Wednesday morning.
Thousands of troops and police are combing rugged terrain around Kangnung for the final two agents believed to be still at large.
